intro: Spermacoce hillii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. The plant is often grown as an ornamental due to its unique flowering habit and attractive foliage.
